newsitem.title: INDIA: Delhi shares end higher on foreign buying.
newsitem.headline: Delhi shares end higher on foreign buying.

text.p: Strong buying by foreign institutional investors (FIIs) coupled with scattered buying by domestic mutual funds drove Delhi share prices to a higher close on Thursday, brokers said.
The bourse's benchmark index closed 8.22 points higher at 777.33 points.
"Resumption of buying by the FIIs was the main factor behind the upward movement in share prices," said one broker.
Some other traders said the rise in share prices was only a technical correction and was unlikely to last long.
"The recovery was mainly a technical correction as some of the stocks were in an oversold position due to short-selling by speculators," said B.K. Nagpal of brokers B.B. Portfolio.
Reliance Industries rose 1.30 rupees to 301.90 on speculative buying, brokers said.
State Bank of India gained 4.50 rupees to 308.75 on buying by the FIIs, they said.
Nestle India quoted 8.35 rupees higher at 258.90.
Larsen and Toubro inched up 1.00 rupee to 213.70.
